intro: Scorodosma arabica, commonly known as the Arabian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals. Scorodosma arabica thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain insect species.
